direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental to object comparison and have similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods involve comparing objects, though 'equals' checks for equivalence and 'compare' for ordering.
Both methods involve checking the state of the object, though 'isLocked' checks for modification capability.
Both methods modify the internal state of the ComparatorChain, though 'addComparator' directly alters the chain.
Both methods modify the internal state of the ComparatorChain, though 'setComparator' directly alters the chain at a specific index.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require the initialization of the ComparatorChain for proper comparison.
The 'compare' method must be invoked to determine the order of objects before checking for equality.
Both methods verify the equality of objects and handle similar exceptions.
